text: Media player is a word that describes computer software that can play more than one type of media (multimedia). Media players can usually play both audio (sound) and video files. Microsoft Windows comes with a media player already on it, Windows Media Player. Some other media players are Quicktime, iTunes, Real Player and Winamp. iTunes comes on every Mac computer. == List of media players == Name Audio Video Operating System License Developer 1by1 align=center align=center Windows own AIMP align=center align=center Windows own AlbumPlayer align=center align=center Windows own ALLPlayer align=center align=center Windows own Amarok align=center align=center Linux/UNIX (KDE), Mac OS X and Windows (testing, QT/KDE dependent) GPL aTunes align=center align=center Windows, Linux, Solaris GPL Bearshare align=center align=center Windows own broadPlayer align=center align=center Web based - works in modern browsers own BS.Player align=center align=center Windows own Chroma align=center align=center Mac own cmus align=center align=center POSIX- compatible GPL Exaile align=center align=center Linux GPL Extended Module Player align=center align=center Linux, Solaris, FreeBSD GPL Festastic! align=center align=center Linux, Mac, Windows own Flash MP3 Player align=center align=center Web based - works in modern browsers own Flash player update align=center align=center Linux, Windows open source flash player update FLV-Media Player align=center align=center Windows Proprietary (Freeware) flv player align=center align=center Windows, Linux Open-source flv player foobar2000 align=center align=center Windows own GOM player align=center align=center Windows own Kantaris align=center align=center Windows GPL / LGPL KMPlayer align=center align=center Linux, Mac, Windows GPL LoomTV 1.0 align=center align=center Mac, Windows proprietary (freeware) iMesh align=center align=center Mac, Windows own iTunes align=center align=center Mac, Windows own jetAudio align=center align=center Windows Freeware (basic edition) Cowon America J. Music Jukebox align=center align=center Windows own yasssu.com align=center align=center Windows & Mac yasssu GmbH Zinf align=center align=center Linux, Windows GPL Zoom Player align=center align=center Windows own Zune align=center align=center Windows own Many media players use libraries. The library helps you organize, or catalog, your music into categories such as genre, year, rating or other. Good examples of media players that include media libraries are Winamp, Windows Media Player, iTunes, RealPlayer, Amarok and ALLPlayer. ==Notes== #Other Winamp versions are Amiamp (AmigaOS), Dosamp (MS-DOS), and Macamp (Mac OS). Category:Software
title: Media player
